Originating from
National 0
Localprov 0
others 20

Originating from
National 100
Localprov 50 each
others 20

At national level based on requests of ministry of cooperatives labor and social welfare and national NGOs network MENARID INRM practices were presented to these stakeholders via two separate seminars
Based on request of technical deputies 60 persons and general directors 32 persons of FRWO 2 workshops were held that MENARID approaches were presented through
Based on request of joint secretariat of international projects in IRAN the experiences of MENARID in marketing were presented to the members
At provincial level 3 universities Gorgan Sari and Mashhad requested MENARID information and reports

description.narrative: Communitydriven climateresilient approaches and techniques for sustainable land and water management demonstrated through INRM practices
Increase in global environmental benefits with cobenefits for local development in demonstration sites

comment.narrative: Baseline measured in Y1

a 73000 tons of carbon valuing USD416000 US57 per ton through sequestration of 60000 tons and emission reduction of 13000 tons of carbon
b Two 2 PES mechanisms support conservation and promote biodiversityfriendly alternative livelihoods at demonstration sites
c 4 sub projects at demonstration sites for rehabilitation of irrigation and rain fed areas of 4000 hectares rehabilitated and delivering 30 increased water use efficiency
d 4 sub projects at demonstration site for improving resilience to climate change forest and rangelands cover in project area increased by 10

a the project has contributed to climate change mitigation through sequestrating 37076 tons of carbon
b4 PES mechanisms put in place Conservation of biodiversity project rangeland management to conserve plant diversity in Behabad site in Yazd Province Payment for carbon sequestration implementation of regulating line planting trees and water management in Razin site in Kermanshah Province Payment for countering land degradation planting of tamarisk in degraded agricultural lands in order to counter the encroachment of moving sand in Hamoun site in Sistan and Baluchestan Province Payment for increasing water use efficiency repair and restoration of qanat in Amidabad village in Semnan Province
c6 projects on rehabilitation of irrigation and rain fed were done Rehabilitation of around 2700 meters of Qanat in Amid Abad hableerud basin improving water irrigation efficiency through rehabilitation of 1600 meters irrigation channels in Asad Abad 700 ha watershed management in Razin of Kermanshah rehabilitation of 1340 meters of Qanat in KarimabadYazd Increase water efficiency of agricultural through water transfer pipes in Kamkoyeh 1340 meters and 1000 meters in Karimabad constructing a forestry park 100 ha based on rain harvesting
d 5 rangeland management cases 2 new in this reporting period in Kermanshah 170 ha Yazd 130 ha and Hablerud 3300 ha were done totaly

description.narrative: Increase in bestpractice organic and traditionallocal innovations in land and water management biodiversity conservation and climate change resilience

comment.narrative: Current use measured in Y1
8 innovations at demonstration sites

8 innovations at demonstration sites were established one new in this reporting period that is producing 4 solar driers to demonstrate in each pilot sites
Traditionally extra vegetable and fruits were dried to be kept for a longer course of time The system they used to it is not hygienic market acceptable and healthy Solar food dehydrator is a simple set which led the farmer to dry their materials in dust and insect free environment Fruits and vegetable are dried in shade to keep their essential oils and vitamins It help rural to take benefit of sun and there is no need of other sources such as fuel which is getting more expensive these days This set is suitable for a gardener who has one or more fruit garden Result of primarily tests is satisfactory and local people are interested to make more sets for their own
8 innovations at demonstration sites

8 innovations at demonstration sites were established one new in this reporting period that is producing 4 solar driers to demonstrate in each pilot sites
Traditionally extra vegetable and fruits were dried to be kept for a longer course of time The system they used to it is not hygienic market acceptable and healthy Solar food dehydrator is a simple set which led the farmer to dry their materials in dust and insect free environment Fruits and vegetable are dried in shade to keep their essential oils and vitamins It help rural to take benefit of sun and there is no need of other sources such as fuel which is getting more expensive these days This set is suitable for a gardener who has one or more fruit garden Result of primarily tests is satisfactory and local people are interested to make more sets for their own

description.narrative: IWRM and WUE strategies in place with institutional ownership secured and best approaches mainstreamed into national and regional planning frameworks by end of project

comment.narrative:
Weak policies communication coordination resulting in fragile or nonexistent IWRM approaches in place
Water Use Efficiency is poorly understood and often not considered in water management decisions

IWRM and Water Use Efficiency Strategies in place Technical management participatory and advocacy lessons from demonstration sites developed into presentation packages with best practices mainstreamed into national and regional approaches by end of project

Two Water Use Efficiency Strategies were prepared by participation of local communities water agency Jahade agriculture natural resource organization and project technical experts in Tehran province Base on these strategies an organization established that named Ab Baran that those farmers who are responsible for water management are its members This organization is responsible for implementing the strategies

IWRM and Water Use Efficiency Strategies in place Technical management participatory and advocacy lessons from demonstration sites developed into presentation packages with best practices mainstreamed into national and regional approaches by end of project

Two Water Use Efficiency Strategies were prepared by participation of local communities water agency Jahade agriculture natural resource organization and project technical experts in Tehran province Base on these strategies an organization established that named Ab Baran that those farmers who are responsible for water management are its members This organization is responsible for implementing the strategies

description.narrative: Number of marketbased financial nonmonetary and tradeoff assessments of the loss of ecosystems services provisioning regulating cultural in 4 provinces

comment.narrative: None
Four comprehensive integrated assessments of market based nonmonetary and tradeoff in ecosystem services

Completion of four comprehensive integrated assessments were reported in last year PIR and in this reporting period two analytical reports on cost of land degradation at watershed level in 4 pilot sites and land degradation prioritization in 3 pilot sites using LADA methodology were prepared
Four comprehensive integrated assessments of market based nonmonetary and tradeoff in ecosystem services

Completion of four comprehensive integrated assessments were reported in last year PIR and in this reporting period two analytical reports on cost of land degradation at watershed level in 4 pilot sites and land degradation prioritization in 3 pilot sites using LADA methodology were prepared

description.narrative: To remove barriers to Integrated Natural Resources Management INRM by developing and strengthening gendersensitive institutional knowledge capacity and coordination and by demonstrating and upscaling successful sustainable land and water management practices that address gender concerns as well

Enhanced resilience to climate change at demonstration site due to adaptation and mitigation measures eg resistant varieties vegetative buffers and wind erosion control
No of project participants women and men in demonstration sites who are vulnerable to either LD CC IW and BD loss as measured through membership to community groups

comment.narrative:
0 hec
Total 3039 active population in project pilot sites

At least four types of resilienceenhancing measures employed in 10000 hec at 4 demonstration sites
50 of vulnerable resident population between 18 years 60 years women and men in 12 villages at demonstration sites involved in project through community groups Village Development Committees women groups etc

5 types of resilienceenhancing measures employed in 13714 ha at 4 demonstration sites that include
Wind erosion control in Sistan 50 ha 20 ha new in this reporting period Flood control and Soil erosion control 12500 ha 5000 ha in Kermanshah and 6000 ha in Hableerud are new in this reporting period sustainable agriculture 40 ha 33 ha in Kermanshah and 7 ha in Yazd are new in this reporting period cultivation resistance species Medical plant cultivation wild almond cultivation pistachio and saffron cultivation to use less water 1124 ha 1024ha new in this reporting period Totally 2208 persons 361 new persons men and women involved in the project management

description.narrative: Overarching improvement in water resource management quality and availability through appropriate demonstration project execution

comment.narrative: Weak policies communication coordination resulting in fragile or nonexistent IWRM WUE approaches in place
4 projects on IWRM in 12 villages at demonstration sites to lead towards WUE Strategy

7 projects in 8 villages that include Rehabilitation of around 2700 meters of Qanat in Amid Abad hableerud basin improving water irrigation efficiency through rehabilitation of 1600 meters irrigation channels in Asad Abad 700 ha watershed management in Razin of Kermanshah rehabilitation of 1340 meters of Qanat in KarimabadYazd Increase water efficiency of agricultural through water transfer pipes in Kamkoyeh 1340 meters and 1000 meters in Karimabad constructing a forestry park 100 ha based on rain harvesting methodology in vahdat abad Yazd Sediment removal in Sarabshahhousein river 60000 cubic meters project is going to prepare a joint program between water agency and agriculture center to improve irrigation efficiency which will cover 2800 ha that include 22 villages in hableerud site
4 projects on IWRM in 12 villages at demonstration sites to lead towards WUE Strategy

7 projects in 8 villages that include Rehabilitation of around 2700 meters of Qanat in Amid Abad hableerud basin improving water irrigation efficiency through rehabilitation of 1600 meters irrigation channels in Asad Abad 700 ha watershed management in Razin of Kermanshah rehabilitation of 1340 meters of Qanat in KarimabadYazd Increase water efficiency of agricultural through water transfer pipes in Kamkoyeh 1340 meters and 1000 meters in Karimabad constructing a forestry park 100 ha based on rain harvesting methodology in vahdat abad Yazd Sediment removal in Sarabshahhousein river 60000 cubic meters project is going to prepare a joint program between water agency and agriculture center to improve irrigation efficiency which will cover 2800 ha that include 22 villages in hableerud site

description.narrative: 1-MIS system (established) and baseline studies on all sites (undertaken) 2-Gender sensitive MIS system (established) and baseline studies (undertaken) 3-Stocktaking of national INRM policies, programmes, budgets and projects, and PTD , PES and other relevant best practices of relevance to INRM (undertaken) 4-Root Cause analysis of natural resource problems and INRM issues (undertaken) 5-Number of public officials and local community members trained and exposed to INRM issues and best practices, to PTD, to alternative livelihoods etc 6-Number and quality of IEC material developed, disseminated and advocated 7-Number of local community based groups developed 8-Number of assessment and evaluation exercises (undertaken) 9-Studies on CBA, on PES, on PTD, on alternative livelihoods etc (undertaken) 10-PES initiative and pilot (undertaken) 11-PMU established and staff / consultants recruited 12- regular project M&E (undertaken) 13-Annual audit

comment.narrative: 1-enhanced MIS system for INRM at FRWO : doesn't exist 2-appropriate gender sensitive MIS system at FRWO : doesn't exist 3-Comprehensive and integrated information of national INRM policies, programmes, budgets and projects, PTD , PES and other relevant best practices of relevance to INRM : does not exist (or is weak) 4-Root causes of natural resource problems and INRM challenges : weak in knowledge and information 5-Extent of knowledge and capacity of public officials and local community on enhanced INRM and best practices in PTD and alternative livelihoods : weak 6-Extent of knowledge products and information available on INRM : insufficient 7-Extent local community based groups are involved in INRM issues : insufficient 8-Baseline information and evaluations of INRM : insufficient 9-Knowledge products on cost-benefits (CBA) of INRM, participatory technology development (PTD) and on alternative livelihoods : insufficient 10-Knowldge products and experience of payment for environmental services (PES) : insignificant and insufficient 11-organisational capacity to implement new development instruments (i.e. a project PMU that can become instituionaly functional at FRWO) : non-existent
No result is expected during 2019 as the project is open to take necessary actions towards project closure.
Actions undertaken jointly with UNOPS towards successful closure in Q1 2020
